alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 14 at 7:27PM PDT until September 14 at 8:30PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: The National Weather Service in Elko has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Elko County in northeastern Nevada... * Until 830 PM PDT. * At 727 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.1 and 0.4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 inches in 15 minutes. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Wildcat Drainage. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central Elko County Heavier rain rates were over the SW corner of the burn area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5 INCHES IN 15 MINUTES
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
